#summary USB Virtual Serial to UART Interface

The latest version of this firmware is available in the latest [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/downloads/list Micropendous Distribution] or via [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/checkout SVN] in the `/Micropendous/Firmware/USBtoSerial` directory.

*Purpose:* Communicate with other electronic devices over the [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_asynchronous_receiver/transmitter UART] interface.  The LUFA version of [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/browse/trunk/Micropendous/libs/LUFA/Projects/USBtoSerial/ USBtoSerial] uses 3-pin UART (TXD, RXD, GND) while the [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/browse/trunk/Micropendous/Firmware/USBtoSerial/ Micropendous version] implements full flow control.  [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/diff?spec=svn759&r=759&format=side&path=/trunk/Micropendous/Firmware/USBtoSerial/USBtoSerial.c Compare the differences.]

*Source Code:* [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/browse/trunk/Micropendous/Firmware/USBtoSerial  View] or [http://www.Micropendous.org/Distribution Download]

*Targets*: USB AVR based hardware

*USB Mode:* Device-mode enumerating as USB Virtual Serial Port

*Status*: _Working_

== Usage ==

Compile and load USBtoSerial firmware onto your USB AVR by following the [ProgramAndTest] tutorial.

Connections to other devices are as follows:

|| *Micropendous*      || *UART* ||
|| *0* - PD2 _(RXD1)_  || RXD ||
|| *1* - PD3 _(TXD1)_  || TXD ||
|| *2* - PD4 _(CTS)_   || CTS ||
|| *4* - PD1 _(RTS)_   || RTS ||
|| *3* - PD5 _(DSR)_   || DSR ||
|| *5* - PD0 _(DTR)_   || DTR ||
|| *6* - PD6 _(DCD)_   || DCD ||
|| GND                 || GND ||

== Testing ==

Create a [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Null_modem Null Modem] loopback by connecting *0*/PD2_(RXD1)_=*1*/PD3_(TXD1)_, *2*/PD4_(CTS)_=*4*/PD1_(RTS)_, and *3*/PD5_(DSR)_=*5*/PD0_(DTR)_=*6*/PD6_(DCD)_.  For the [http://code.google.com/p/micropendous/source/browse/trunk/Micropendous/libs/LUFA/Projects/USBtoSerial/ LUFA] 3-pin UART you only need to connect *0*/PD2_(RXD1)_=*1*/PD3 _(TXD1)_.

http://micropendous.googlecode.com/svn-history/r800/trunk/Micropendous/Firmware/USBtoSerial/USBtoSerial_NullModem_with_Loopback.jpg

Follow the instructions in [Serial] to connect to the device using a serial terminal and any characters you type will be looped back but only while the loopback wire is in place.
